termsPage.title: AI Ehon Maker Terms of Service

0.heading: Article 1 (Purpose and Scope)
0.content:
These Terms of Service (hereinafter referred to as the “Terms”) govern the conditions of provision and use of the web application “AI Ehon Maker” (hereinafter referred to as the “Service”), operated by our company (hereinafter referred to as the “Company”). All individuals or entities that use this Service (hereinafter referred to as the “Users”) are required to agree to these Terms before using the Service.

1. Guidelines, policies, notices, or other provisions separately presented by the Company (collectively, the “Individual Provisions”) shall constitute a part of these Terms. In the event of any conflict between these Terms and the Individual Provisions, the Individual Provisions shall prevail.
2. By using this Service, the User is deemed to have agreed to these Terms. Users who do not agree with these Terms are not permitted to use the Service.

1.heading: Article 2 (Definitions)
1.content:
In these Terms, the following terms shall have the meanings set forth below:

1. “Service” refers to the web application “AI Ehon Maker” provided by the Company, which includes features such as AI-driven illustrated book generation, a credit-based billing system, and community functionality.
2. “User” means any individual or entity that views or uses this Service.
3. “Registered User” means a User who has created an account by following the registration process prescribed by the Company, and logs in via email address and password or OAuth authentication.
4. “Credits” refer to the virtual currency used within the Service for generating illustrated book pages, etc. Users may purchase Credits through Stripe or other payment methods. Credits cannot, under any circumstances, be converted into cash or electronic money.

2.heading: Article 3 (Account Registration and Management)
2.content:
1. Registration Process
   Users shall register an account by entering the required information, such as an email address and password, in accordance with the procedures specified by the Company. If the applicant has previously had their account suspended due to a violation of these Terms, the Company may refuse the registration.

2. Use by Minors
   If the User is a minor, the User must obtain consent from a legal guardian (such as a parent) in advance. The Company may refuse the use of the Service or suspend the account if the Company is unable to confirm such consent.

3. Account Management
   The User shall take responsibility for properly managing their login credentials (email address, password, etc.) and shall not transfer or lend them to any third party, nor allow any unauthorized use. The Company shall not be liable for any damages arising from the User’s negligence in password management, improper use, or leakage to third parties, except in cases where the Company has acted with willful misconduct or gross negligence.

4. Changes and Deletion of Account
   The User may change their registered information or withdraw (delete their account) in accordance with the procedures specified by the Company. The handling of Credits upon withdrawal is governed by Article 7.

3.heading: Article 4 (Credits and Payment)
3.content:
1. Purchase of Credits
   The User may purchase Credits by paying the specified amount through Stripe or another payment method in the Service (e.g., 500 yen for 300 Credits, 1,000 yen for 650 Credits, etc.). Once the payment is completed, the Credits will be reflected in the User’s account.

2. Use and Consumption of Credits
   When the User uses the feature to generate illustrated book pages, a specified number of Credits (e.g., 20 Credits per page) will be consumed. The same applies to re-generation or additional pages. If there are insufficient Credits in the User’s balance, generation cannot proceed.

3. Validity and Refund of Credits
   (1) Credits do not have a set expiration date. However, the Company reserves the right to establish an expiration date in the future. In such cases, the Company shall provide advance notice in accordance with Article 14.
   (2) Credits purchased by the User are non-refundable and cannot be exchanged for cash under any circumstances. However, this shall not apply if otherwise stipulated by law or if the User is unable to use the Credits due to the Company’s willful misconduct or gross negligence.
   (3) Except in cases where the Service is terminated or where there is a legal obligation to provide refunds, the Company shall have no obligation to refund Credits in cash or other means.

4. Inquiry into Credit History
   The User may check their credit balance and purchase/consumption history within the Service.

4.heading: Article 5 (Illustrated Book Generation)
4.content:
1. Generation Process
   Based on the page count or theme specified by the User, the Service uses a large-scale language model (such as GPT) to generate titles and text, and subsequently uses Stable AI or similar to generate images. The User can preview the result and regenerate if necessary, but each regeneration will consume additional Credits.

2. Quality and Consistency of Generated Content
   The Service does not guarantee the accuracy, usefulness, or consistency of outputs from AI models. Since there may be inaccuracies or inappropriate expressions, the User is responsible for performing regenerations or edits at their own discretion.

3. Saving and Editing
   The User can freely save the illustrated book they generated. Even after saving, they can regenerate or edit it, but additional Credits will be consumed with each regeneration.

5.heading: Article 6 (Community Features)
5.content:
1. Publishing Settings
   The User may post their generated illustrated book to the community under one of the following modes: “Public,” “Limited,” or “Private.” If “Limited,” only those who know the URL can view the content.

2. Viewing and Reactions
   Guest Users can view only the cover and title of a posted illustrated book. Registered Users can view all pages, post comments, and give likes (subject to any conditions separately specified by the Company).

3. Prohibited Content
   Content that violates public order and morals, infringes the rights of third parties, contains defamation, discrimination, violence, obscene material, or other content deemed inappropriate by the Company is prohibited.

4. Response to Violations
   If the Company confirms that a post violates these Terms or any law, the Company may take actions such as deleting the content in question or suspending the account.

6.heading: Article 7 (Account Suspension and Handling upon Withdrawal)
6.content:
1. Account Suspension
   If a User violates these Terms or any applicable law, the Company may, without prior notice, suspend or delete the account, and any Credits held by the User may be forfeited or invalidated. In cases of malicious misconduct or serious violation, the Company may take legal action against the User, including claims for damages.

2. Credits upon Withdrawal
   If a User voluntarily withdraws, any unused Credits at the time the account is deleted will be forfeited, and no refunds shall be given. However, this does not apply if refunds are required by law or if the Company’s willful misconduct or gross negligence is recognized.

3. Handling of Saved Data
   After withdrawal, the illustrated books and community posts saved by the User may be deleted. The Company cannot guarantee complete deletion if other Users have already quoted or downloaded such data.

7.heading: Article 8 (User Responsibility and Self-Burden)
7.content:
1. Users shall act at their own responsibility and expense when using this Service. If a dispute arises with another User or a third party, the User shall resolve it at their own responsibility and expense.
2. The copyrights and any legal responsibility regarding illustrated books or comments created or posted by the User shall belong to that User. In the event of a claim or demand from a third party, the User shall bear responsibility and expense to resolve it.

8.heading: Article 9 (Prohibited Conduct)
8.content:
When using this Service, Users shall not engage in the following acts:

1. Acts that violate laws or public order and morals
2. Acts that infringe the intellectual property rights, portrait rights, privacy rights, honor, or other rights of the Company or any third party
3. Acts of registering, posting, or transmitting false or misleading information
4. Acts that place excessive load on the server, unauthorized access, reverse engineering, source code analysis, or any other acts that interfere with the normal operation of the Service
5. Transmitting or posting information that is discriminatory, violent, obscene, pornographic involving minors, or otherwise contrary to public order and morals
6. Using another person’s credit card or payment method without authorization, or committing chargeback fraud or other unlawful payment activities
7. Transferring, selling, or exchanging Credits, or obtaining or using Credits illegally
8. Creating multiple accounts on a large scale, or illegally obtaining referrals or similar bonuses
9. Any other conduct deemed inappropriate by the Company

9.heading: Article 10 (Intellectual Property Rights and Ownership)
9.content:
1. Company Rights
   All intellectual property rights related to the Service (including programs, trademarks, logos, images, designs, etc.) belong to the Company or the rightful owner. Users shall not use (copy, modify, distribute, etc.) these rights without the Company’s permission.

2. Rights to User-Generated Content (Illustrated Books, etc.)
   (1) The copyright of text and images generated by the User (hereinafter referred to as “Generated Content”) shall, in principle, belong to the User.
   (2) The Company retains a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use Generated Content as necessary for the purposes of promotion, improvement, and testing of the Service.
   (3) The User shall ensure that no third-party rights are infringed by their Generated Content, and shall resolve any disputes at their own responsibility and expense.

10.heading: Article 11 (Disclaimer)
10.content:
1. The Company makes no warranty, whether express or implied, as to the accuracy, usefulness, or fitness for a particular purpose of any content generated (including text created by AI or images generated by Stable AI) via the Service.
2. The Company shall not be liable for any damages (including indirect damages and lost profits) arising from the User’s use or inability to use the Service, except in cases of willful misconduct or gross negligence by the Company.
3. The Company shall bear no responsibility for disputes between Users or between a User and a third party, except in cases where the Company has acted with willful misconduct or gross negligence.
4. The Company shall not be liable for any losses arising from service interruptions or delays caused by force majeure, such as server downtime, communication failures, natural disasters, or legal requests, that exceed the Company’s reasonable control.

11.heading: Article 12 (Changes, Suspension, and Termination of the Service)
11.content:
1. The Company may, upon prior notice, change, add, or terminate the contents of the Service.
2. The Service may be temporarily suspended due to system maintenance, emergency responses, natural disasters, or legal requirements. The Company shall not be liable for any damages caused by such suspensions, except in cases of willful misconduct or gross negligence.

12.heading: Article 13 (Handling of Personal Information)
12.content: The Company shall handle the User’s personal information appropriately in accordance with its Privacy Policy, which is separately established. By using the Service, the User is deemed to have agreed to the Privacy Policy. For users residing in the EU, UK, or other jurisdictions, the Company shall comply with relevant mandatory laws (such as GDPR and UK GDPR).

13.heading: Article 14 (Amendments to the Terms)
13.content:
1. The Company may amend these Terms from time to time.
2. In the event of an amendment to these Terms, the Company shall announce such amendment on the Service or on the Company’s website at least seven days prior to the effective date. In cases of significant amendments, the Company may also notify the registered email address.
3. If the User continues to use the Service after the amendment becomes effective, the User shall be deemed to have agreed to the amended Terms.

14.heading: Article 15 (Governing Law and Jurisdiction)
14.content:
1. These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Japan. However, if mandatory consumer protection laws in the User’s country of residence apply, such laws may take precedence.
2. Any dispute arising out of or in connection with the Service or these Terms shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the court having jurisdiction over the location of the Company in Japan in the first instance. However, if the User is a consumer residing outside Japan and local laws provide other protections, this provision shall apply only to the extent that it does not conflict with such local laws.

15.heading: Article 16 (Severability)
15.content:
1. If any provision of these Terms or part thereof is determined to be invalid or unenforceable under applicable law, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect.
2. In the event of any questions or disputes arising from or in relation to these Terms, the Company and the User shall make efforts in good faith to resolve the matter amicably.

0.heading: Article 1 (Purpose and Application)
0.content: This Privacy Policy (hereinafter referred to as “this Policy”) sets forth the policies for handling personal information and equivalent information (hereinafter collectively referred to as “Personal Information, etc.”) collected or used in connection with the web application “AI Ehon Maker” (hereinafter referred to as “the Service”) operated by our company (hereinafter referred to as “the Company”). All users (hereinafter referred to as “Users”) of the Service shall be deemed to have agreed to this Policy.

1.heading: Article 2 (Information Collected)
1.content:
In providing the Service, the Company may collect the following information:

1. Registration Information: Email address, password, user name, profile image, etc. entered/provided by the User during account registration or profile setup
2. Information on Generated Content: Titles, text, and image data of picture books created by AI, as well as feedback provided when regenerating content
3. Payment Information: Credit card numbers, payment methods, purchase history, etc. (including information handled on services such as Stripe)
4. Log Information: Access dates, IP addresses, browser type, device information, referrer URLs, and other access logs
5. Information Automatically Obtained Through Cookies or Similar Technologies: User usage status, session information, etc.
6. Inquiry/Support Information: Email addresses, inquiry contents, attached files, etc. that Users send via inquiry forms

2.heading: Article 3 (Purpose of Use)
2.content:
The Company uses the collected Personal Information, etc. for the following purposes:

1. To provide and operate the Service
2. To respond to inquiries from Users and provide account support
3. For the development, improvement, and stable provision of AI-based picture book generation features
4. To manage credits purchased or used, and to process payments
5. To investigate and address violations and maintain a safe and sound service environment
6. To analyze User usage and access trends for functional improvements and new service development
7. To send maintenance information or important notices necessary for service operations
8. To create and publish statistical data processed in a format that does not identify individuals
9. For other purposes separately notified to Users in advance

3.heading: Article 4 (Cookies and Tracking Technologies)
3.content:
1. The Company may use cookies, web beacons, or similar technologies to make the Service more convenient for Users, and to optimize advertisement distribution and analyze usage.
2. Users may reject or delete cookies through their browser settings, but this may result in some features of the Service becoming unavailable.
3. The Company may use third-party analytics services (e.g., Google Analytics) to collect and analyze site visit status or usage trends. The handling of data collected by such analytic services is subject to each service provider’s privacy policy.

4.heading: Article 5 (Provision of Personal Information to Third Parties)
4.content:
1. The Company will not provide Personal Information, etc. to third parties without the User’s consent, except in the following cases:
   (1) When required by law
   (2) When necessary to protect the life, body, or property of a person and it is difficult to obtain the User’s consent
   (3) When particularly necessary to improve public health or promote the sound growth of children and it is difficult to obtain the User’s consent
   (4) When it is necessary to cooperate with a national or local government agency or a party entrusted by such in performing legal duties, and obtaining the User’s consent might interfere with the performance of those duties
   (5) When the Company provides such information within the scope necessary to third-party external services (cloud servers, payment services, email distribution services, etc.) to which the Company outsources operations
2. Notwithstanding the preceding paragraph, if the Company does provide information to third parties, the Company will enter into confidentiality agreements with such third parties and take steps to ensure appropriate protection of the User’s Personal Information, etc.

5.heading: Article 6 (Security Measures)
5.content:
1. The Company implements appropriate security measures to prevent leakage, loss, or damage of Personal Information, etc.
2. The Company concludes confidentiality agreements with employees and contractors who handle Personal Information, etc., and supervises them to prevent unauthorized access, loss, destruction, or tampering.
3. In the event of a leak or other serious incident involving Personal Information, the Company will promptly investigate the facts, report and notify the relevant parties and authorities, and take measures to prevent recurrence.

6.heading: Article 7 (User Rights)
6.content:
1. Users may request disclosure, correction, suspension of use, deletion, etc. of their Personal Information, etc. through procedures designated by the Company.
2. If the User is a minor, the legal guardian (such as a parent) may exercise the same rights, depending on applicable laws.
3. The Company may conduct identity verification procedures when responding to requests for disclosure, etc.

7.heading: Article 8 (Protection of Children’s Privacy)
7.content:
1. The Company pays special attention to the protection of minors’ Personal Information, especially children under 13 years of age, and may verify parental consent as necessary.
2. If parents or guardians have concerns regarding the provision of Personal Information by minors, please contact the Inquiry Desk listed at the end of this Policy.

8.heading: Article 9 (International Data Transfer)
8.content: Because the Company uses cloud services, etc., Personal Information, etc. may be transferred and stored in countries outside the User’s country of residence. These countries may have different data protection laws than Japan, but the Company will take appropriate protective measures and protect the User’s Personal Information, etc. in accordance with this Policy.

9.heading: Article 10 (Retention Period)
9.content: The Company retains Personal Information, etc. only as long as it is necessary to fulfill the purpose of use. After the purpose of use has been achieved, or upon the expiration of the storage period required by law or business necessity, the Company will delete or dispose of the information by appropriate methods.

10.heading: Article 11 (Changes to this Privacy Policy)
10.content:
1. The Company may change this Policy at any time.
2. The changes will be announced on the Service or on the Company’s website, and will become effective on the date specified in the announcement or on the effective date determined by the Company.
3. If the User continues to use the Service after the changes become effective, the User is deemed to have agreed to the changes.

11.heading: Article 12 (Contact Information)
11.content:
For any questions regarding this Policy or requests for disclosure, correction, or deletion of Personal Information, etc., please contact the following:

[Contact Information]
Service Name: AI Ehon Maker
Email: aiehonmaker.japan@gmail.com
Other contact methods: Inquiry Form URL, etc.

Upon receiving such requests, the Company will take appropriate and prompt action after confirming the identity of the requester.

3.heading: Telephone
3.content:
090-5607-9750
*We do not respond to phone calls. Please use the contact form or send us an email.

5.heading: Pricing
5.content:
We sell "credits" to use within our application at the following prices (tax included):
• $5 : 400 credits
• $10 : 1000 credits
• $20 : 2100 credits
• $40 : 4500 credits

*Each generated page consumes 15 credits.

6.heading: Additional Fees
6.content: None (no shipping fees, payment processing fees, or transfer fees).

7.heading: Payment Method & Timing
7.content:
• Payment Method: Credit card (Stripe) only.
• Payment Timing: Immediate payment at the time of credit purchase. Once the payment is completed, credits will be added to your account.

8.heading: Service Availability
8.content:
Credits are reflected in your account immediately upon successful payment, allowing you to start generating picture books using AI Ehon Maker right away.
You may also purchase (charge) credits in advance.

9.heading: Refunds & Cancellations
9.content:
Our service provides digital products (credits and AI-generated picture books). Due to the nature of digital content, we generally cannot accept returns or refunds after purchase.
If a system failure or unavoidable circumstance occurs, please contact us for individual assistance.

help.title: AI Picture Book Maker Help
help.description: Learn about the features and how to use AI Picture Book Maker

about.heading: About AI Picture Book Maker
about.content:
AI Picture Book Maker is a service that lets you create beautiful picture books using the power of AI. Choose your theme, genre, character, and art style to create an original picture book in just minutes.

Key Features:
• AI automated story generation
• High-quality picture book illustrations
• Intuitive editing interface
• Community sharing features
• Multiple language support (Japanese and English)

gettingStarted.heading: Getting Started
gettingStarted.content:
【Account Registration】
1. Click the 'Sign Up' button on the homepage
2. Enter your email address, password, and name
3. Click 'Create Account'
4. A confirmation email will be sent - click the link in the email to complete verification

or

Register using your Google account by clicking the 'Login with Google' button

【Login】
You can log in using your registered email address and password, or with your Google account.

【Initial Points】
New users are automatically given 100 points upon registration.

creatingBooks.heading: How to Create Picture Books
creatingBooks.content:
【Basic Creation Steps】
1. Click the 'Create Book' button from the dashboard
2. Select the following settings:
   • Theme: Overall theme of the book (friendship, adventure, etc.)
   • Genre: Fantasy, everyday life, educational, etc.
   • Main Character: The animal or creature as the protagonist
   • Art Style: Watercolor style, cartoon style, etc.
   • Target Age: Expected reader age group
   • Page Count: Can be set between 5-30 pages
   • Output Language: Japanese or English
3. Click the 'Generate Book' button
4. Wait a few minutes for generation to complete (time varies depending on page count)

【About Point Consumption】
Creating a picture book requires 15 points per page
Example: A 10-page book consumes 150 points

editingBooks.heading: Editing and Managing Books
editingBooks.content:
【Editing Features】
You can edit generated books as follows:
1. Select the book you want to edit from 'My Books'
2. Click the 'Edit' button
3. The following editing options are available:
   • Title Editing: Change the title of the book
   • Text Editing: Modify the text content of each page
   • Image Regeneration: Regenerate images you don't like (15 points/image)

【Book Completion and Publishing】
1. Click the 'Finalize' button to complete the book
2. Completed books can be published to the community via the 'Post to Community' button (※coming in a future update)
3. Published books can be viewed by other users and can receive likes and comments

【Viewer Functions】
You can view your book in viewing mode from 'View in Viewer':
• Realistic page-turning effects like a real book
• Sound effects (page-turning sounds)
• Immersive mode (fullscreen display)
• Favorite registration feature

pointSystem.heading: Point System
pointSystem.content:
【How to Acquire Points】
• New Registration: Receive 100 points
• Point Purchase: Purchase points in the app

【Point Usage】
• Book Creation: 15 points/page
• Image Regeneration: 15 points/image

【Purchasing Points】
1. Click 'Purchase Points' on the dashboard
2. Select the desired number of points
3. Enter payment information and complete the purchase

accountManagement.heading: Account Management
accountManagement.content:
【Profile Settings】
You can manage the following from 'My Account':
• Change profile picture
• Change display name
• Change password
• Language settings (Japanese/English)

【Account Linking】
• Link or unlink Google account
• Manage linked social accounts

【Account Deletion】
1. 'My Page' → 'Delete Account' → 'Confirm Deletion'
2. After account deletion, all data will be permanently deleted

troubleshooting.heading: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.content:
【If an error occurs during book generation】
1. Reload the browser and try again
2. Check if you have sufficient points
3. Wait for a while and try again

【If you cannot log in】
• Reset your password
• Check if email verification is completed
• Clear browser cookies

【If images aren't displaying】
• Reload the browser
• Try using a different browser
• Clear cache

faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)
faq.content:
Q: Can I download the picture books I create?
A: The current version only supports viewing in the viewer. Download functionality is planned for a future update.

Q: Who owns the copyright for the picture books?
A: The copyright of created picture books belongs to the user. However, the legal status of AI-generated content may vary by country or region.

Q: Do purchased points have an expiration date?
A: Once purchased, points do not expire.

Q: Is there a limit to the number of books I can create at once?
A: There is no limit to the number of books you can create, as long as you have sufficient points.

contact.heading: Contact Us
contact.content:
If you need support, please contact us using the contact form.
※ When contacting us, please provide as much detail as possible about the situation and any issues you're experiencing for a smoother resolution.

contactPage.title: Contact Us
contactPage.emailTooltip: We will use this email address to contact you
contactPage.contentTooltip: Please be as detailed as possible
contactPage.contentPlaceholder: Please write the details of your inquiry here
contactPage.errorDesc: Failed to send. Please try again.

alert.noEmailDesc: An email address is required to reactivate the account
